Module ZiqiYang
Package org.ziqi

Class Debugger

java.lang.Object
org.ziqi.Debugger
public class Debugger
extends java.lang.Object
Debugger class is used as in-line debugging tool following the Debugging Guideline 4 introduced in lecture: Use Trace and Test Flags.
Author:
Ziqi Yang

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private static boolean m_Trace
    This is a flag specifying if the debugging mode is to turn on and track down all in-line debuggers called from source code.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Debugger()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static void debugBegin​(boolean test, java.lang.String debugString)
    This method is used as the beginning of the in-line debugger.
    static void debugEnd​(boolean test, java.lang.String debugString)
    This method is used as the ending of the in-line debugger.
    private static java.lang.String getCallerInfo()
    This method is used to obtain the name of caller class and caller method of debugger and reformat the string.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Field Details

    • m_Trace

      private static final boolean m_Trace
      This is a flag specifying if the debugging mode is to turn on and track down all in-line debuggers called from source code.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • Debugger

      public Debugger()

  • Method Details

    • debugBegin

      public static void debugBegin​(boolean test, java.lang.String debugString)
      This method is used as the beginning of the in-line debugger. A message will be printed to standard output with
      1. the name of debugger caller class and method,
      2. a detail message,
      3. a flag word "BEGIN".
      Parameters:
      test - When m_Trace flag is false, this parameter will specify if the debugger will be turned on.
      debugString - This is the string expected from caller as the detail message of debugger.

    • debugEnd

      public static void debugEnd​(boolean test, java.lang.String debugString)
      This method is used as the ending of the in-line debugger. A message will be printed to standard output with
      1. the name of debugger caller class and method,
      2. a detail message,
      3. a flag word "END".
      Parameters:
      test - When m_Trace flag is false, this parameter will specify if the debugger will be turned on.
      debugString - This is the string expected from caller as the detail message of debugger.

    • getCallerInfo

      private static java.lang.String getCallerInfo()
      This method is used to obtain the name of caller class and caller method of debugger and reformat the string.
      Returns:
      A formatted string is returned specific the name of caller class and caller method of debugger.
